newsitem.title: CHINA: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 24.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Chinese newspapers - Oct 24.

text.p: Following is a summary of major Chinese political and business stories in leading newspapers, prepared by Reuters in Beijing. Reuters has not checked the stories and does not guarantee their accuracy. Telephone: (8610) 6532-1921. Fax: (8610) 6532-4978.

Qiao Shi, Chairman of the National People's Congress, or parliament, opens the 22nd session of the body's standing committee that will discuss several draft laws, including regulations governing the stationing of troops in Hong Kong after 1997.
A commentary calls for more dialogue between the United States and China to solve bilateral problems and urges Washington not to look on Beijing as a threat.

Chinese Minister of Foreign Trade Wu Yi says Sino-U.S. relations are recovering but disputes over China's entry to the World Trade Organisation and Beijing's Most Favoured Nation status could hold up further progress.
